entry.title: >>> pyconweb.talks.select_speaker('acetakwas')
entry.content:
Come 26th May, 2019, I will be giving a talk on one of the nifty tools that exist in the arsenal of the Pallets Projects: Werkzeug.

Werkeug, which I'd much rather refer to as the WSGI swiss-army knife, is one of those brilliant pieces of software out there that get little attention. I'd say that the fame of Flask is responsible in the case of Werkzeug.

Armin Ronacher, whom I adore so much, created this in YEAR in a bid to XXX.

My talk is titled: Werkzeug: What's in it for me? You can pretty much think of it as an introduction to the good parts of the toolset Werkzeug. Yes, toolset, because it is more of a toolset than a tool.

If you have used Flask, then you have certainly used Werkzeug. But the distinction must be made that, while Flask is a framework, Werkzeug is a library.

PyConWeb is a niche PyCon event. So rather than be a generic PyCon event like many others, the organisers have chosen to take a rather different and interesting approach by narrowing the scope of the event to web technologies.
